website_summaries.verdict: A close competitor of the Mackie. Great specs and quality sound from a highly regarded company.
pros: Built-in compression, 48V of phantom power, and smooth digital effects (including reverb) create a strong, clean sound
cons: USB interface can be difficult to use

customer_reviews.title: easy to use, good customization
customer_reviews.text: i really like this unit. have been using it for a couple of months now. paired with 2 12" yamaha powered speakers. i use it primarily for vocals like a mini sound board. i have the board on a mic stand (using a mount from amazon) in the middle of our practice room so i can make adjustments mid-song. i have also used it a bit to record. hooked it up USB directly to my mac book with logic pro. worked immediately with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: erocksplinter

customer_reviews.title: No Box, Terrible Win10 USB Interface
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, so I wanted SO bad to love this USB mixer, but after 7 hours of trying to get it to work with my PC, I just can't recommend it as a USB interface. It technically works, but the input is so low that the audio is unusable without heavily changing how your PC uses audio input (aka 3rd party programs). The preamps are great, but I needed a USB interface, so I guess I'll get a Mackie or Focusrite. If you want a good mixer for live applications or you have a Mac or Linux system (don't know, don't have 'em), I'm sure this would be awesome. Otherwise, I would say stay far, far away from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Using 10xu for home karaoke
customer_reviews.text: Working great for this audio amateur. USB to computer for Karafun feed and to record performances. Just using Windows sound recorder because I haven't got my head around Cubase. Other karaoke components purchased from Amazon: Mackie Thump 15, Behringer xm8500 microphones (awesome value), CBI mic cables, CSRET HDMI splitter to send Karafun video to TV and monitor. All working great. Mixer has good effects. Solid, quality construction. Took me a while to figure out settings to get signals going where I want: all buttons depressed (i.e. TO ST, USB, MUTE). Gain set to 2-3 oclock to get sufficient signal to USB.
customer_reviews.author: habanero

customer_reviews.title: Noisey pickups. VU meters are terrible
customer_reviews.text: Just to be clear - I know how to properly gain stage. These preamps are simply terrible, the compressors are garbage, and the noise this thing produces makes it unusable. I've owned this and a Behringer mixer and they're both on the same level - don't make the mistake I did, get a better mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Jaja

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what I needed for YouTube and podcasting
customer_reviews.text: Loving it so far. I have my external speakers microphone desktop and tv audio inputs connected and can easy switch around audio inputs without having to change audio settings on Windows 10. The effects and all the other feathers make it worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jlega

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Voltage Printed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for someone outside of US where household electricity is 240V. The box and the user manual both states it is 240V compatible (ie. 110V-240V) but when plugged in, it blew the transformer and smoke came from the unit itself. After checking, I noticed the transformer states 110V and not dual. This brand new mixer went up in smoke within seconds and we never got to check its functionality. I'm in the process of returning it. If you buy it for outside of US, please check the transformer for correct input voltage and don't rely on package or user manual.
customer_reviews.author: DUKO

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good mixer, just had to update driver in Windows to remedy some distortion
customer_reviews.text: Recognized in Linux, and Windows. No issues getting to work right as soon as I updated my windows driver. Works great to output digital audio and get around a lot of noisy cabling I have next to my computers (video cables/...). Solid performance, doesn't sound as good as my Asus Xonar STX, but it has no issues with my high impedance head phones or driving my speakers. I upgraded from the MG10 and am very pleased with this and the free copy of Cubase 10 AI.
customer_reviews.author: Ciaran

customer_reviews.title: THE PACKAGING WAS EXCELLENTLY DONE!!!
customer_reviews.text: It is an amazing mixer. I previously owned a BEHRINGER - although the Yamaha MGUX series is significantly more complex and advanced (but easy to set up and get acquainted to), it is worth every penny! There is ZERO humming noise from the unit, the long throw faders are butter-smooth. This was never the case with the Behringer. I had this unit shipped to Zambia, in Africa, while in its original packaging from the Amazon Seller and nothing else, and it arrived safe with all the extras (XLR Cable etc) intact. Best Investment. The packaging was A-PLUS and the extras were very much appreciated!! Solid deal all round!
customer_reviews.author: ISH3000

customer_reviews.title: Audio interface volume is a total bummer
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to touch on one key aspect of this mixer- the interface. I want to love this unit, really I do, but it drives me absolutely mad with how damn quiet the audio interface signal is. I bought this to line in hardware (Digitakt, Octatrack and Sp404) into my Ableton setup. Was really bummed out how much I have to boost the signal, whether RCA, XLR or TRS, to get anything over -6db. My gain staging is all over the place and the signals are way too hot once I can get them loud enough. Something to be aware of. Everything else is great, but the interface problem defeated my sole inspiration to incorporate the MX-10 into my rig.
customer_reviews.author: Edward A Burke

customer_reviews.title: Good for Karaoke mix
customer_reviews.text: I have a set top TV box that can play Chinese Karaoke app. So I connect the TV box to my TV via HDMI, then feed the TV L/R audio out to the Yamaha mixer for karaoke music source. I have 2 Shure wire mic feed to the Yamaha, and another econo wireless mic box output feeding into Yamaha. After playing with different settings and tuning the Yamaha, I have a perfect Karaoka system that is flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Y Chan

customer_reviews.title: Very good and easy to manage sound.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a more expensive mixer that produced great sound, but was not easy to manage during performances, with this Mg 10xu. We use it for two guitars and two vocals and it gives great quality, easy to manage sound, as well as very good effects that also are easy to manage during performances. We have used it with only mono performance through a L1 Compact to date..
customer_reviews.author: Ron Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Not Recomended
customer_reviews.text: Terrible, its broken already 2 hours on the phone with Yamaha and I have to ship it to them and then they will send one out! Its not 2 months old!
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: very nice mixer
customer_reviews.text: This mixer replaces my old mixer. The layout is clear and simple to understand with color-coded knobs and zones. Sound quality is great. But there is no mute button for each channel and no output for recording to your PC. The back of the console chassis heats up a bit, but the user manual states that this is normal and not to worry about it. That said, I really love this mixer. Overall, it's really great and it makes my audio/video network much more organized and neat looking, without cables going in all different directions
customer_reviews.author: Wen Tsen

customer_reviews.title: I love the design of this mixer
customer_reviews.text: I love the design of this mixer. We purchased this for our kids so they could record their gaming sessions together. Yamaha's audio products are superb quality and I don't think there is a better mixer on the market for this kind of price. We've been using this for about three months without any issue. Oh, and the kids LOVE the effects that can change their voice.
customer_reviews.author: stavs

customer_reviews.title: too much fun
customer_reviews.text: bought this mixer to connect my shure BETA 98H/C Clip-On microphone to my yanagisawa sax and my korg work station, and i must say i'm having way too much fun with it. all the different effects sound great with my sax. the different types of reverb also sound really good with my keyboard. I highly reccomend this setup, if you want to take your music to the next level. usb connectivity to my laptop makes recording a snap.
customer_reviews.author: jon henri

customer_reviews.title: Put This In Your Mix!
customer_reviews.text: This baby rocks, and is so much fun! The voice and keyboard effects give you endless possibilities for creativity in mimicking recorded songs or your own material. I am a solo keyboard player, and bought it to unify my two keyboards and my voice when performing.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Fella

customer_reviews.title: Great little submixer. Typical Yamaha great sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Love this little guy. Use it in my midi studio as a sub mixer in combination with an iMac running Logic ProX and a Focusrite Clarett. Compact, plenty of inputs and outputs, and clean as a whistle, as usual with Yamaha audio. If this has the number of inputs and outputs you need, and you’re not too concerned about EQ capabilities, you can’t go wrong with this guy. Compare price with Mackie. I use a QSC Touchmix for my live sound system and this Yamaha equals the sound quality, if not the complexity.
customer_reviews.author: Doug W

customer_reviews.title: Cannot get enough gain out of the board no matter how how you turn it up. Common review problem!
customer_reviews.text: The soundboard with very warm quick. It also does not have enough gain when going into Adobe audition or any other sound software. This needs to be fixed otherwise it causes extra post processing. If you are just a podcaster save time and just buy the Rode Podcaster Pro. This Yamaha isn't even in the same ballpark as the Rode
customer_reviews.author: Jason B

customer_reviews.title: Maybe not professional level, but close enough for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about getting the XU version (with the effects) or the standard one without the effects. Personally I won't use the effects, but that could change, I haven't really tried them. What sold me on the XU version was the USB input/output. It saves a lot on cabling and (probably) has a better quality sound than analog I/O to a computer. Certainly seems good to me so far. Oh - if you do get this then you need to get the proper drivers from the Yamaha web site. The default windows ones won't share the input and output stream between applications.
customer_reviews.author: Alan G MCSPORRAN

customer_reviews.title: This is a great device and it’s packed with features
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used older models of Yamaha mixers, but this one really steps it up. I have the comfort of knowing how to use it (from older models) but the effects and the additional gain and voltage selection buttons make this truly great. I was also surprised that I can connect via USB and get a premium sound card for my computer.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Doebling

customer_reviews.title: An excellent mixer for sound and flexibility.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very flexible and versatile mixer. The layout becomes quickly intuitive. Sound is excellent and quiet. Having individual mute buttons really helps. It’s light and portable but just a bit large.
customer_reviews.author: Billy The Kid

customer_reviews.title: Compact slicks looks but not enough power and the FX function is not obvious
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the YAMAHA name and the look. Especially, when I saw the features “KARAOKE “ , “VOCAL ECHO” because I am going to use it for Karaoke night. I Connected this directly to a pair of 1000watt powered speaker. The sound is weak even though I crank the volume to maximum. It sounds dried, I don’t see much of the FX. I guess, maybe this requires a preamplifier for it to work . I gave 3 stars for the looks and low price .
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mixer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hook up and use, great clean sound. The overall size is perfect too, compact yet not so small that it is difficult to operate. Hooked up the USB to my old MacBookPro running Logic, selected MGXU audio and started playing virtual piano's immediately. The unit replaced my old Mackie mixer. Not looking back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Great Mixer features and flexibility.
customer_reviews.text: The Yamaha MG20XU is truly impressive in features and performance. First impressions regarding the setup, features,and performance have been very good. This mixer has a huge number of ports and flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha MG20XU mixer.
customer_reviews.text: We bought the MG 220Xu as a front of house mixer to rive the DBR 15 active monitors. the mixer is easy to set up and work, and of course, Yamaha are incredibly well made and reliable. We use professional series digital mixers and floor monitors on stage and have for years. At their price point they are hard to beat at any level. Great buy, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Scotsman

customer_reviews.title: Incredible sound and quality build
customer_reviews.text: I already own the MG12XU and love it. Needed a smaller mixer for ceremonies and this one is perfect. The quality is way above the smaller Behringer mixers I currently own. They are going in the trash after using both Yamaha's this past weekend. Thanks Yamaha for making a reasonably priced great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dwitthoft

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with windows 10.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it, this is completely and utterly not compatible with windows 10. I tried installing drivers for Yamaha for this unit for everything every which way from here to Sunday and could never get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Is use this Yamaha mixer for my karaoke system along with the Yamaha RX-A3080, RBH SVT towers, RBH SA-500DSP sub amp, and my HTPC. This Yamaha MG12 mixer is a must-have. I use the XLR output to my Yamaha RX-A3080. Sound quality is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Audio Pharmacist

customer_reviews.title: Great little mixer
customer_reviews.text: I have used different mixers over the years, I run a sound company and perform live my self as well on regular basis, Yamaha mixers have always been one of my preferred choice. clear sound, built in effect, perfect for trio or 4 piece band
customer_reviews.author: Korelucian

customer_reviews.title: Used but good.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used, so I can't really complain a lot. The description said, damage to the front and back. I didn't really see any damage around those areas. Other than light scratches around plastic part where you change the fxs. The problem is the group one and strereo fader the knobs are facing inwards towards each other; still works. I'm happy with the purchase it was 140 bucks off since it was used. I may keep it.
customer_reviews.author: HiWilly

customer_reviews.title: Great Board
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after having problems with another well known brand. I should have just went with Yamaha in the first place. This board is great. The effects are nice, I really only use a bit of reverb. The inputs are flexible and this board has plenty for my 5 piece band. Love this board!
customer_reviews.author: L. Covington

customer_reviews.title: SMALL BUT MIGHTY
customer_reviews.text: If you don't need excess XLR channels this unit fits the bill. I can also daisy-chain it to my 20 channel Yamaha mixer if I ever need more channels. The USB option is a plus, but I haven't used it so I cannot comment. But I can say you'll need to order a separate cable.
customer_reviews.author: Walter M.

customer_reviews.title: ok except for FX channel hiss
customer_reviews.text: Nice feel. Sturdy and layout is good. Did not find the compressors that useful. Cables seemed to work ok. Problem is with the FX channel- hisses just loudly enough to be annoying. Even if nothing is plugged in and FX are all turned to minimum, the minute you push the ON button for the FX channel it starts hissing. Speaker volume is quite minimal (living room).
customer_reviews.author: Randall Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Super great in every way
customer_reviews.text: Super great in every way. I have no regrets with having bought this. I wish it had the Tronsmart Bluetooth adapter built in, but it's easy enough to add one for $20, and then this can talk to Bluetooth speakers, too, or get input from an Android DJ station, which is what my phone becomes when I'm using this.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: It sounds great, and I use it when I don't need ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic, but highly functional analog mixer. It sounds great, and I use it when I don't need to roll out one of my wireless, much more expensive mixers.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Fu

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a couple of these to manage a simple mic and speaker setup for outdoor theater performances. It's tiny compared to the old 12 channel Mackie board we had been carting around, and fits our needs very well. Might not be a great choice for live mixing, and doesn't have any added effects, but for a basic board, it's awesome
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get your home karaoke set up
customer_reviews.text: I tried a few mixer to get home karaoke going. This one is a really great balance of value and quality. Return others to store. It’s a little overwhelming for first time set up, plenty video online you can find.
customer_reviews.author: april

customer_reviews.title: Great for streaming
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is so easy to use, you can also connect 3 more instruments
customer_reviews.author: Sev

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great.
customer_reviews.text: This is a must for streamers/broacasters. This package specifically. Its always nice to have the package of 4 XLR cables, and the 3.5 mm male to 2 1/4 inch males are great for connecting a phone or tablet. The MG12XU itself is great. The preamps sounds nice and clean. My mic is dynamic, which requires max gain from this thing. Even then, I hear little to no noise. The DAC is very loud, which is a bit of a double edged sword for those who use low impedence headphones, but it's nice and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S.

customer_reviews.title: It's good. Really happy with this decision
customer_reviews.text: It's good. Really happy with this decision. I kind of wish I had more aux options with it, but I'm not using it for live performance, just recording and listening. So it's great. I love having a mixer like this, it makes me really feel like I am in control of everything. Maybe that's not a good thing, but I'm ok with the illusion from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Upshaw

customer_reviews.title: Want to bring your computer audio to a new level? Try one of these.
customer_reviews.text: We use this for a DJ Controller, to Play Rocksmith, for watching guitar videos and playing through a Line 6 at the same time, multiple mic Karaoke, and even some recording on the computer. With powered monitors and the ability to enter the separate computer audio you can fill a room with sound and have a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: CJDMOON

customer_reviews.title: Nice effects and its easy to adjust the settings
customer_reviews.text: My first mixer. It was a bit confusing at first with setting up, but it does the job. Nice effects and its easy to adjust the settings.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Used in pieces
customer_reviews.text: I bought a used mixer $138. Expected at least for it to come in one piece. Part of The styrofoam was missing so it was clunking around. When I took out the unit, pieces were loose inside. Be wary of the used ones. Otherwise great unit.
customer_reviews.author: Paul T

customer_reviews.title: Nice simple mixer
customer_reviews.text: Nice simple mixer. The color scheme is visually nice and quickly directs the eyes to the correct knob. It's fairly compact because of the rotary rather than linear channel volume controls. Good number of mic preamps as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great Mixer
customer_reviews.text: Great mixer, upgraded from a Yamaha MG06X. My only concern is that I've noticed that the 60 Hz hum from this mixer is even more pronounced than when I had the MG 06X. I'm not too sure how to fix this hum. When I record, it doesn't seem like audio software picks up the hum, it is only present when I try to monitor myself through the phone jack on the mixer. Any solution? Thanks, James
customer_reviews.author: jac049

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice little mixer
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice little mixer. It's massive overkill for what I usually use it for but I like having a mixer around in case I need it. I love that it has a one knob compressor on two of the mic. channels, which makes using it for PA or voice stuff a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my son and he is very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Am Azon Woman

customer_reviews.title: Seem to work as expected
customer_reviews.text: My wife like it, we use for karaoke system, connect this to a Yamaha AV , need to buy conversion cables. But it worked, we use YouTube as our video source from chromecast
customer_reviews.author: chim cánh cut

customer_reviews.title: efeects or no effects, that is the question
customer_reviews.text: i returned this board because i needed a board w effects so i got the same board w the effects mg10ux and am happy
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Gelbman

customer_reviews.title: Overkill for streamers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas present for my son, who thinks he is a budding internet sensation. Doesn’t use 99% of the buttons but it looks cool and he loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Smoke
customer_reviews.text: Just got it, plugged it into the wall and turned it one, took about 30 seconds before it made a sound and the smoke came out, and a horrible smell.
customer_reviews.author: RubenF

customer_reviews.title: This was a Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am still learning the mixer. I have not gotten enough time to play around with it because of school. But so far it is wonderful. Can’t wait to see it’s full potential
customer_reviews.author: chasehunt

customer_reviews.title: So far it's working well.
customer_reviews.text: This is the mixer I ordered. It arrived on time. So far, it works well. I thought there would be a 2nd aux control/output, but there isn't, it's just another basic monitor mix, not a true aux.
customer_reviews.author: Papa

customer_reviews.title: A great piece of gear!
customer_reviews.text: This is a super solid mixer with great preamps. It also functions as an ideal audio I/O for computer work.
customer_reviews.author: Willy Nilly

customer_reviews.title: to replace an old Behringer sound board that was wasted. This is the perfect solution for smaller churches
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our small church, to replace an old Behringer sound board that was wasted. This is the perfect solution for smaller churches, and the sound quality is fantastic. Easy to use, even for the sound booth volunteers that have little experience.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Armbrust

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: Been using this 2 nights a week for 6 plus months to run karaoke. Bought it specifically because it has both onboard effects and compression on the vocal channels. I might buy another one just to get the variant with faders instead of knobs and keep the knobs as a backup but otherwise I wouldn't go any other way for what I'm doing. 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Metz

customer_reviews.title: JK'ing Wit Joey Podcast
customer_reviews.text: You be the judge... Season one using Zoom. Season two using this Yamaha MG10XU.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Mixer.  Idiot Proof!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for small house concerts. The ease of connection is a dream and hooked up perfectly to my Bose L1 speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Karen H. (Austin, TX)

customer_reviews.title: Very good for my duo group
customer_reviews.text: This mixing board is perfect for my solo and duo performances. Effects are pretty good. Especially the reverb. Would recommend to my friends and buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ron A.

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Overall a very good mixer. Compact Solid construction. Only issue that I have is every once in while we get a pulse that creates funny sound during Karaoke, not sure if it is because of mixer or something else but I am going to try Allen & Heath one to see if I get the same sound
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mixer this is quite bigger than my old one works wonderful!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy P.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for karaoke
customer_reviews.text: I ran a karaoke system and used a earlier version so now I am starting up again I had to get a new one. Very good system and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Quick & Easy setup with great sound!
customer_reviews.text: It was as advertized. I use the Yamaha MG10 for my karaoke sound system which consists of 2 15" 2way speakers , a subwoofer and a 12" floor monitor. I also run 2 wireless and one wired microphone. The Yamaha MG10 works great and is quick and easy to set up. I love it
customer_reviews.author: G3 Soul

customer_reviews.title: Very good board.
customer_reviews.text: This board is SOLID! Its wonderful and ive had no problems with it so far. I love this mixer, would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a budget board.
customer_reviews.author: Osiris Rauda

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: IT WORKS!!! Solid start for most tech (Audio Equipment)...but forreal this Mixer is GREAT, can plug all the things into it! Would mixer again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha support is not that supportive.
customer_reviews.text: Microphone was xlr-connected to channel 1 then later 5/6, either only transmitted to one new yamaha powered speaker dbr10. Still don’t know why. I am kind of disappointed but will try to setup again if not I will return Yamaha and never buy Yamaha again. Will post my final review in the next day.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: One the best mixers for streaming
customer_reviews.text: So amazed how the sound quality and the effects! I used this for Twitch streaming! So Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: oliver boston

customer_reviews.title: A go to mixer for bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a super homerun for the money, do not get the smaller one than this ...This is the one you want!
customer_reviews.author: Autodidact

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best USB audio mixer I used so far
customer_reviews.author: Christian Portillo

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and quiet. Not a ton of head room
customer_reviews.text: Lots of possibilities. Only wish would be that it sent a hotter signal to my DAW.
customer_reviews.author: SFN

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: For my son and he’s very happy with the mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Suzan F

customer_reviews.title: I can believe I didn't buy this earlier. This ...
customer_reviews.text: I can believe I didn't buy this earlier. This has a solid 2 in/out audio interface with built in preamps and compressors. I use this as my daily driver on light recording tasks on my computer and can take it with me whenever I need an analog mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Mitting

customer_reviews.title: WARNING !!! DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT !!
customer_reviews.text: WARNING !!!!!! DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT !!!! It malfunctioned as soon as I turned it on. Horrible sound quality , USB function squalls and squeaks. This mixer is terrible !!! Don't waste your money or your time !!!! You WILL be disappointed if you buy this device !!! It's JUNK !!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Brothers

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This Mixer is so easy to use and so easy to set up, it sounds really good too. Works great for what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heating up
customer_reviews.text: It gets to hot while using and it is worst when you turn on the phantom for a microphone. Randomly cuts the quality of the sound it’s why I’m sending it back,
customer_reviews.author: Pablo e.

customer_reviews.title: Great Mixer at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I’m a big fan of this. I didn’t realize how necessary this piece of equipment would be for my jams. I run a Roland JDXI, Volca Beats, Volca Kick and a Volca Nubass into it and it’s improved overall quality and structured my creativity on a way I didn’t know I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Merrill

customer_reviews.title: Great little unit
customer_reviews.text: Got it used from Amazon warehouse, I think. Have it running a Alto ts212s and two Alto troupers in a small bar venue for live music and movies.very happy, especially considering what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect for my setups
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is exactly what I needed. It's perfect for my setups. The onboard compressor already came in handy a number of times. Perfect number of channels, I never feel limited. For bigger setups the venue usually has their own board and audio anyway. Fantastic board.
customer_reviews.author: Jazz Singer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I am able to use Home theater system with this preamplifier. I wish it had more micro phone inputs instead of amplified inputs
customer_reviews.author: Anand

customer_reviews.title: Great Mixer
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic mixer for a newbie. I use it with Yamaha: 2xDXR15, 1xDXS15(sub), 2x Bose F1(subs) and a JBL EON208P system. I get enough imputs and great sound.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Excellent portable AND flexible mixer.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect mixer for the road. It's both powerful and lightweight. I'm an electronic musician, so the simple compressor, surprisingly good onboard effects and send/return path allows for a wide range of experimentation. Faders would b ideal, but I was willing to sacrifice for portability. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: ladycoll

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Product! Its does everything that it says it does in product description.
customer_reviews.author: Mercile Martinsen

customer_reviews.title: Great board for small gigs that don't need a lot of lines.
customer_reviews.text: No frills mixer board, but it's sturdy and had great reviews. After the first use, the band liked it.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Works as well as my M-audio box, with much more to offer!

customer_reviews.text: It took a little bit to get the mixer dialed in but, it works great!

customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike , works better than expected , able to zone in the tones I need for guitar and vocals

customer_reviews.text: It wasn't what I wanted. Refiunded quickly and efficiently. Thanks to the seller and Amazon!

customer_reviews.text: Great piece of equipment at good price. I've borrowed one of these many times and just got my own.

customer_reviews.title: Completely versatile and integrates nicely to any setup!
customer_reviews.text: Everything you could possibly need in a compact mixer and more. Phantom power✔️Multiple effects✔️Dedicated channel for USB✔️AC powered✔️Multiple I/O ✔️Dual XLR/TRS Inputs✔️Latest Cubase software✔️ Satisfied customer 100% ✔️✔️

customer_reviews.text: Do you want to produce live sound on budget? This will do the trick.

customer_reviews.text: Everything is great in this mixer, but some effects doesn't work right.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it
customer_reviews.text: It works as it should, the effects work nicely, wish I could have more than one on at a time; For the price I'm happy with with it.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Covington

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer, just gets hot.
customer_reviews.text: Love how it's built. Very sturdy. Only issue is it seems to get hot. Not sure if that will be an issue. Otherwise, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sharia Marcus

customer_reviews.title: This board is great. Came with a free copy of Cubase AI ...
customer_reviews.text: This board is great. Came with a free copy of Cubase AI that I installed immediately. I am in a metal band and the board handles everything great, the effects work flawlessly, and the recording quality is better than we had any reason to expect. Yamaha and Steinberg is a great combination, one I will surely be sticking with in all future endeavours.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Evans

customer_reviews.title: First class mixer with FX, AAA+++
customer_reviews.text: Just can’t say enough good things about this mixer, it is fabulous!
customer_reviews.author: Henry Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works and Looks Great
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly, looks great. Little bit of heat on the back of the board but not too terible
customer_reviews.author: Jacob L Rathbun

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: I used this for podcasting and voice over work. Easy to use and and really gives your audio that professional quality.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Ragle

customer_reviews.title: Lacks some things I would have liked
customer_reviews.text: There are plenty of good things about this mixer, but I'm just going to note two things I dislike about it. I dislike that there are no "mute" buttons on the input channels. You can turn the level down all the way, but it's nicer to have the mute button with the ideal light that tells you which input channels are muted. The second thing that I dislike is that there's only a single FX send output. It's nice to have both an AUX send and FX send, like the Behringer products. After having purchased the MG10XU, I am considering returning it in favor of the Behringer X1204USB.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C.

customer_reviews.title: VERY NICE MIXER!!! Great options and 24/192 khz USB 2 recording!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this mixer!!! I just wish I could find out its Dynamic Range on the In and Outputs. It sounds great and records to my cubase VERY EASY!!!! It also outperfoms some other audio interfaces I was using when it comes to perfomance in cubase!
customer_reviews.author: Power Von' Strokin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect karoke
customer_reviews.text: Love this mixer. I have used many different brands of mixers, Behringer, Mackie and others brands, they can't compare. I run it through my Bose T1, because I don't care much for the Bose effects. Sounds clean and clear with great effects.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

product_meta.title: YAMAHA MG10XU 10-Input Stereo Mixer With Effects
product_meta.description: Size:10-input| style:USB Interface with EffectsMG10XU 10-Channel Mixer with Effects. Now in its third incarnation, the MG Series embodies the pursuit of design excellence, and incorporates some of the same technologies developed for use in high-end professional consoles, including studio-quality preamps, powerful digital processing, and a rugged, reliable construction. The MG10XU is the ten-channel version of the series, with four mono XLR and 1/4" hybrid inputs along with three stereo line inputs. The MG10XU boasts an intuitive interface with capacities suitable for a diverse range of users and applications. For installed, recording, or live music settings, the solid construction and flexible design of these consoles lets you shape your sound with confidence, continually delivering peak performance and a level of sound quality and reliability that has made it a leader in its class.
feature_bullets: 10 channel mixer with USB and SPX digital effects
Featuring studio grade discrete class A D PRE amps with inverted Darlington circuit providing fat, natural sounding bass and smooth, soaring highs
3 band EQ and high pass filters give you maximum control and eliminate unwanted noise, resulting in a cleaner mix
1 knob compressors allow easy control resulting in livelier guitars, punchier bass lines, a tighter snare and a cleaner vocal sound
MG Series mixers feature a rugged, impact resistant, powder coated metal chassis; Equivalent input noise 128 dBu, residual output noise 102 dBu
Note: Please refer to the user manual before use
Dimensions(W×H×D): 244 millimeter x 71 millimeter x 294 millimeter (9.6x2.8x11.6 inches)
